item.title: CV
item.description: Education PhD - Mathematical Modelling Ryerson University, in progress Research area: stochastic biochemical networks MSc - Applied Mathematics McMaster University, 2016 Thesis: A Comparative Study of Techniques for Estimation and Inference of Nonlinear Stochastic Time Series, under Ben Bolker BSc - Mathematics / Computer Science Ryerson University, 2014 Thesis: Software for Multi-level Monte-Carlo Simulation of Stochastic Biochemical Kinetics, under Silvana Ilie Experience Software Developer 7D Surgical, 2017-2019

item.title: About
item.description: I’m a PhD student just starting at Ryerson University, working on the modelling of stochastic biochemical networks. @dbarrows LinkedIn Google Scholar @dexter.thephotographer dexter@barrows.io I recently worked at 7D surgical developing software for surgical devices, and before that at the Biophotonics and Bioengineering Laboratory (BBL) at Ryerson University and Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre. My work involved GPU-accelerated medical image processing, UI design, realtime Doppler optical coherence tomography (OCT) processing and display, and computational anatomy segmentation.
